options.-P, --PORT: Specify the port. Alternatively, use the WEKA_PORT env variable

options.-f, --format: Specify in what format to output the result (format: 'view', 'csv', 'markdown', 'json' or 'oldview')
options.-o, --output: Specify which columns to output. May include any of the following: muted,type,count,title,description,action (may be repeated or comma-separated)

options.-F, --filter: Specify what values to filter by in a specific column. Usage: column1=val1[,column2=val2[,..]] (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.--muted: List muted alerts alongside the unmuted ones
options.--no-header: Don't show column headers when printing the output

add.description: Create a new S3 object store bucket connection

arguments.name: Name of the Object Store bucket

options.--site: The site of the Object Store, default: local (format: 'local' or 'remote')
options.--obs-name: Name of the Object Store to associate this new bucket to
options.--hostname: Hostname (or IP) of the entrypoint to the storage
options.--port: Port of the entrypoint to S3 (single Accesser or Load-Balancer)
options.--bucket: Name of the bucket we are assigned to work with
options.--auth-method: Authentication method. S3AuthMethod can be None, AWSSignature2 or AWSSignature4
options.--region: Name of the region we are assigned to work with (usually empty)
options.--access-key-id: Access Key ID for AWS Signature authentications
options.--secret-key: Secret Key for AWS Signature authentications
options.--errors-timeout: If the Object Store bucket link is down for longer than this, all IOs that need data return with an error (format: duration between 1 minute and 15 minutes)
options.--prefetch-mib: How many MiB of data to prefetch when reading a whole MiB on object store. Default Value is 128MiB (format: 0..600)
options.--max-concurrent-downloads: Maximum number of downloads we concurrently perform on this object store in a single IO node (format: 1..64)
options.--max-concurrent-uploads: Maximum number of uploads we concurrently perform on this object store in a single IO node (format: 1..64)
options.--max-concurrent-removals: Maximum number of removals we concurrently perform on this object store in a single IO node (format: 1..64)
options.--max-extents-in-data-blob: Maximum number of extents' data to upload to an object store data blob
options.--max-data-blob-size: Maximum size to upload to an object store data blob (format: capacity in decimal or binary units: 1B, 1KB, 1MB, 1GB, 1TB, 1PB, 1EB, 1KiB, 1MiB, 1GiB, 1TiB, 1PiB, 1EiB)
options.--sts-operation-type: AWS STS operation type to use. Default: none (format: 'assume_role' or 'none')
options.--sts-role-arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume. Mandatory when setting sts-operation to ASSUME_ROLE
options.--sts-role-session-name: An identifier for the assumed role session. Length constraints: Minimum length of 2, maximum length of 64. with no spaces. =,.@-  check Pattern: [\w+=,.@-]*
options.--sts-session-duration: Enter the duration of the temporary security credentials in seconds, the value must be between 900 to 43200, the default set to 3600
options.--color: Specify whether to use color in output (format: 'auto', 'disabled' or 'enabled')
options.-H, --HOST: Specify the host. Alternatively, use the WEKA_HOST env variable
options.-P, --PORT: Specify the port. Alternatively, use the WEKA_PORT env variable
options.-C, --CONNECT-TIMEOUT: Timeout for connecting to cluster, default: 10 secs (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.-T, --TIMEOUT: Timeout to wait for response, default: 1 minute (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.--profile: Name of the connection and authentication profile to use
options.--dry-run: Only test the command, don't affect the system
options.--skip-verification: Don't verify the connection to the given storage

list.description: Lists security policies applied when joining containers.
usage: weka security policy join list [--color color]

options.--color: Specify whether to use color in output (format: 'auto', 'disabled' or 'enabled')
options.-H, --HOST: Specify the host. Alternatively, use the WEKA_HOST env variable
options.-P, --PORT: Specify the port. Alternatively, use the WEKA_PORT env variable
options.-C, --CONNECT-TIMEOUT: Timeout for connecting to cluster, default: 10 secs (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.-T, --TIMEOUT: Timeout to wait for response, default: 1 minute (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.--profile: Name of the connection and authentication profile to use
options.-f, --format: Specify in what format to output the result (format: 'view', 'csv', 'markdown', 'json' or 'oldview')
options.-o, --output: Specify which columns to output. May include any of the following: mode,policyNames,policyIds (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.-s, --sort: Specify which column(s) to take into account when sorting the output. May include a '+' or '-' before the column name to sort in ascending or descending order respectively. Usage: [+|-]column1[,[+|-]column2[,..]] (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.-F, --filter: Specify what values to filter by in a specific column. Usage: column1=val1[,column2=val2[,..]] (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.-R, --raw-units: Print values in raw units (bytes, seconds, etc.). When not set, sizes are printed in human-readable format, e.g 1KiB 234MiB 2GiB.
options.-U, --UTC: Print times in UTC. When not set, times are converted to the local time of this host.
options.--no-header: Don't show column headers when printing the output

Be cautious when deviating from the default setting; consult the documentation or Customer Success to avoid misuse. (format: 'none', 'full' or 'partial')

options.--config: Config json file to use instead of dumping
options.--color: Specify whether to use color in output (format: 'auto', 'disabled' or 'enabled')
options.--hosts: A list of host ids to run command on (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.--exclude-hosts: A list of host ids to explicitly not run command on (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.--ssh-opts: Options to pass to the underlying ssh commands (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.-S, --forward-status: Return the largest of the remote command return values
options.--drives: Run command on all servers with drive containers
options.--computes: Run command on all servers with compute containers
options.--frontends: Run command on all servers with frontend containers
options.--dry-run: Display the commands that would be run without actually executing them
options.--print-hosts: Only print the selected hosts. Can be used as an input file for pdsh. e.g.: `weka debug pdsh --computes --print-hosts > hosts.txt`, `pdsh -w ^hosts.txt echo hello`
options.--by-ips: Connect to hosts using ips instead of hostname
options.-o, --format-output: Formats the output of the commands more cleanly

options.-C, --container: The container to get revision from
options.--color: Specify whether to use color in output (format: 'auto', 'disabled' or 'enabled')

flock.description: Commands used to debug the flocks

options.--color: Specify whether to use color in output (format: 'auto', 'disabled' or 'enabled')

list.description: List all active locks on the backend taken for the file

options.--color: Specify whether to use color in output (format: 'auto', 'disabled' or 'enabled')
options.-H, --HOST: Specify the host. Alternatively, use the WEKA_HOST env variable
options.-P, --PORT: Specify the port. Alternatively, use the WEKA_PORT env variable
options.-C, --CONNECT-TIMEOUT: Timeout for connecting to cluster, default: 10 secs (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.-T, --TIMEOUT: Timeout to wait for response, default: 1 minute (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.--profile: Name of the connection and authentication profile to use
options.-f, --format: Specify in what format to output the result (format: 'view', 'csv', 'markdown', 'json' or 'oldview')
options.-o, --output: Specify which columns to output. May include any of the following: nodeId,start,end,type,owner,extensionIdentifier,extensionProto,extensionGeneration,extensionFlags,extensionTs (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.-s, --sort: Specify which column(s) to take into account when sorting the output. May include a '+' or '-' before the column name to sort in ascending or descending order respectively. Usage: [+|-]column1[,[+|-]column2[,..]] (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.-F, --filter: Specify what values to filter by in a specific column. Usage: column1=val1[,column2=val2[,..]] (may be repeated or comma-separated)
options.--no-header: Don't show column headers when printing the output
